resources.string: After pressing this button, Android will start searching for other Bluetooth devices that have made themselves discoverable. When Bluetooth is not yet enabled, you will be asked first to enable it.
After pressing this button, Android will stop searching for new devices but will keep Bluetooth on. The system will wait for your input.

All found Bluetooth devices will be displayed here. There is nothing yet because you have not started searching and discovered any devices. New devices will be displayed per row, in the format: device name - device MAC address.

In the overflow, the settings can be accessed. In the settings the preferred device name, MAC address and UUID for the device you want to connect to, can be made. Device name and MAC address are optional while UUID is required to make a connection.
After pressing this button, a file explorer with files from your memory, will pop up. Once a file has been selected, it will be send in the background to the connected device.
After pressing this button, a file explorer with files to be send to you, will pop up. From the list of files, one can be selected to be send to your device and saved into your download folder.

After pressing this button, the connection between your Android and the other device will be cancelled. This is very useful to safe power since having an unused connection is unnecessary power consuming.
"The application works only with Bluetooth enabled. "
Your device does not support Bluetooth.
" Do you want to connect to: "
A device matched your preferred name.
A device matched your preferred MAC address.
Bluetooth was disabled. Do you want to enable it?
